title: Repository schema (chlaa)
text: standalone R package implementing stochastic cholera outbreak model odin2 (dust2 backend), utilities fitting, counterfactual simulation, forecasting, health economic evaluation. End users need odin2 installed: repository commits generated C++ bindings simulation fitting work clean checkout. odin2 required developers want edit inst/odin/*.R regenerate bundled outputs (see docs/packaging.md).

title: Repository schema (chlaa)
text: DESCRIPTION, NAMESPACE, LICENSE: standard R package metadata Makefile: developer helper targets (make regen, make check-sync, make check--binaries) R/: package code (functions) cholera_model.R: simulation model cholera_model_fit.R: adds observation model filtering / likelihood man/: prebuilt documentation (keeps R CMD check quiet without roxygen) tests/: unit tests (including smoke tests simulation fit paths) tools/: developer scripts regeneration drift checks docs/: project documentation (model mapping, packaging notes) vignettes/: end--end analyst workflows (fit, scenarios, economics/optimisation) inst/extdata/econ/: externalised economics defaults (unit costs DALY parameters) _pkgdown.yml: pkgdown site configuration .github/workflows/pkgdown.yaml: docs build/deploy workflow

title: Repository schema (chlaa)
text: Discrete-time stochastic compartmental model Daily incidence variables (inc_*) reset zero_every = 1 Cumulative outputs (cum_*) scenario evaluation economics cholera_model.R Adds data likelihood cases (Negative Binomial) using reporting_rate obs_size

title: Repository schema (chlaa)
text: cholera_parameter_info(): default values + metadata cholera_parameters(): build parameter list overrides cholera_parameters_validate(): basic sanity checks cholera_simulate(): run model via dust2 cholera_generator(): internal generator getter (packaged generator runtime odin2 compile) cholera_fit_pmcmc(): particle MCMC fitting (monty + dust2) cholera_fit S3 helpers (print, summary, cholera_posterior_summary()) draw extraction + parameter updating (cholera_update_from_fit()) posterior predictive simulations (cholera_simulate_posterior()) cholera_trigger_time_from_sim() cholera_make_aa_scenarios(): AA scenario templates cholera_scenario(), cholera_run_scenarios() cholera_compare_scenarios() (optionally economics) cholera_counterfactual_grid(): tidy grid scenario knobs cholera_run_counterfactual_grid() cholera_forecast_from_fit() plotting helpers cholera_plot_ppc() posterior predictive checks cases cholera_forecast_scenarios_from_fit(): paired scenario forecasts + differences vs baseline cholera_plot_scenario_forecasts(): overlay facet, absolute differences cholera_health_econ(): costs + DALYs using model accumulators cholera_optimise_budget(): constrained allocation optimiser (grid/continuous modes) general plotting helpers CE plane plot

title: Repository schema (chlaa)
text: Typical workflow: 1. pars <- cholera_parameters() 2. sim <- cholera_simulate(pars, ...) 3. fit <- cholera_fit_pmcmc(data, pars, ...) 4. pars_cal <- cholera_update_from_fit(fit, pars) 5. sc <- cholera_make_aa_scenarios(pars_cal, trigger_time = ...) 6. runs <- cholera_run_scenarios(pars_cal, sc, time = ...) 7. cmp <- cholera_compare_scenarios(runs, baseline = "baseline", include_econ = TRUE) 8. Forecasts: - cholera_forecast_from_fit(fit, ...) - cholera_forecast_scenarios_from_fit(fit, scenarios = sc, ...)

title: Repository schema (chlaa)
text: make check-sync: validates committed generated files inst/odin/generation_manifest.csv. make check--binaries: fails compiled artefacts tracked src/ inst/. CI runs checks R CMD check.

title: Authors and Citation
text: OJ Watson. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Watson O (2026). chlaa: Cholera Outbreak Simulation Anticipatory Action Modelling. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/OJWatson/chlaa.
code: @Manual{,   title = {chlaa: Cholera Outbreak Simulation and Anticipatory Action Modelling},   author = {OJ Watson},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/OJWatson/chlaa}, }

title: chlaa
text: Stochastic cholera outbreak simulation anticipatory action (AA) modelling tools. package vendors generated dust2 C++ model code, can run simulation fitting without odin2 installed runtime. (odin2 needed regenerate bundled code; see docs/packaging.md.)

title: chlaa
code: library(chlaa)  pars <- cholera_parameters(Sev0 = 2) sim <- cholera_simulate(pars, time = 0:180, n_particles = 50, dt = 0.25, seed = 1) sim

what: Compare scenario outcomes against a baseline — cholera_compare_scenarios
title: Compare scenario outcomes against a baseline — cholera_compare_scenarios
text: Produces scenario comparison table including infections, symptomatic cases, deaths, doses, treatment counts, (optionally) costs DALYs ICERs vs baseline.

title: Compare scenario outcomes against a baseline — cholera_compare_scenarios
code: cholera_compare_scenarios(   scenario_runs,   baseline,   include_econ = TRUE,   econ = NULL,   wtp = NULL )

title: Compare scenario outcomes against a baseline — cholera_compare_scenarios
text: scenario_runs Output `cholera_run_scenarios()`. baseline Baseline scenario name. include_econ TRUE, include health economic outputs (requires `cholera_health_econ()`). econ Optional named list economic parameter overrides (passed `cholera_health_econ()`). wtp Optional willingness--pay per DALY averted NMB/INMB outputs.

title: Compare scenario outcomes against a baseline — cholera_compare_scenarios
text: data.frame scenario-level means deltas vs baseline.

what: Build a counterfactual grid of AA-like scenarios — cholera_counterfactual_grid
title: Build a counterfactual grid of AA-like scenarios — cholera_counterfactual_grid
text: creates grid scenarios crossing selected policy knobs.

title: Build a counterfactual grid of AA-like scenarios — cholera_counterfactual_grid
code: cholera_counterfactual_grid(   trigger_time,   horizon,   aa_start_offset = 0,   wash_duration = 120,   care_duration = 120,   chlor_effect = 0.2,   hyg_effect = 0.2,   lat_effect = 0.1,   cati_effect = 0.1,   orc_capacity = 500,   ctc_capacity = 100,   vax_regimen = c("none", "1dose", "2dose"),   vax_total_doses = c(0, 280000),   vax_delay = c(0, 14),   vax_campaign_days = 6,   vax_dose_interval = 14,   prefix = "cf" )

title: Build a counterfactual grid of AA-like scenarios — cholera_counterfactual_grid
text: trigger_time Numeric trigger day. horizon End cap intervention windows (typically max(time)+1). aa_start_offset Vector offsets (days) added trigger_time (negative = earlier). wash_duration Vector durations (days). care_duration Vector durations (days). chlor_effect, hyg_effect, lat_effect, cati_effect Vectors fractional effects. orc_capacity, ctc_capacity Vectors capacities. vax_regimen Vector regimens: "none", "1dose", "2dose". vax_total_doses Vector total doses. vax_delay Vector delays AA start (days). vax_campaign_days Campaign duration (days) per round. vax_dose_interval Interval rounds (2-dose) days. prefix Scenario name prefix.

title: Build a counterfactual grid of AA-like scenarios — cholera_counterfactual_grid
text: data.frame columns: scenario, modify, knob columns.

what: Fit the cholera model to incidence data using pMCMC (monty + dust2) — cholera_fit_pmcmc
title: Fit the cholera model to incidence data using pMCMC (monty + dust2) — cholera_fit_pmcmc
text: Expects data.frame columns: - time: numeric times (days) - cases: integer case counts times

title: Fit the cholera model to incidence data using pMCMC (monty + dust2) — cholera_fit_pmcmc
code: cholera_fit_pmcmc(   data,   pars,   n_particles = 200,   n_steps = 2000,   seed = 1,   prior = NULL,   packer = NULL,   proposal_var = 0.02 )

title: Fit the cholera model to incidence data using pMCMC (monty + dust2) — cholera_fit_pmcmc
text: data Data frame columns time cases. pars Starting parameter list. n_particles Number particles dust2 filter likelihood. n_steps Number MCMC steps. seed Random seed. prior Optional monty prior model. NULL, uses `cholera_default_prior()`. packer Optional monty packer. NULL, uses `cholera_default_packer()`. proposal_var Proposal variance (scalar) diagonal random walk.

title: Fit the cholera model to incidence data using pMCMC (monty + dust2) — cholera_fit_pmcmc
text: `cholera_fit` object (also keeps monty class) attributes:   packer, prior, start_pars, data.

title: Fit the cholera model to incidence data using pMCMC (monty + dust2) — cholera_fit_pmcmc
text: Likelihood defined inside `inst/odin/cholera_model_fit.R`: cases ~ NegativeBinomial(mu = reporting_rate * inc_symptoms, size = obs_size)

what: Forecast summary from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_from_fit
title: Forecast summary from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_from_fit
text: Runs model multiple posterior draws returns time--time summaries (mean quantiles) selected variables.

title: Forecast summary from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_from_fit
code: cholera_forecast_from_fit(   fit,   pars = NULL,   time = NULL,   vars = c("inc_symptoms", "cum_symptoms", "cum_deaths"),   include_cases = TRUE,   obs_model = c("nbinom", "mean"),   quantiles = c(0.025, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.975),   n_draws = 100,   burnin = 0.5,   thin = 1,   seed = 1,   dt = 0.25,   n_particles = 1,   n_threads = 1,   deterministic = FALSE,   modify = NULL )

title: Forecast summary from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_from_fit
text: fit `cholera_fit` object (compatible). pars Baseline parameter list. NULL, uses `attr(fit, "start_pars")`, otherwise `cholera_parameters()`. time Vector times simulate. vars Character vector model variables summarise. include_cases Logical; include predicted observed cases variable "cases". obs_model One "nbinom" "mean". quantiles Numeric vector quantiles return. n_draws Number posterior draws use. burnin Burn-proportion integer. thin Thinning interval. seed Seed. dt Model time step. n_particles Particles per posterior draw. n_threads Threads dust2. deterministic Run process model deterministically (supported). modify Optional named list parameter modifications applied draw update.

title: Forecast summary from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_from_fit
text: tidy data.frame columns: time, variable, mean, quantiles, n_samples.

title: Forecast summary from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_from_fit
text: `include_cases = TRUE`, also generates predictive distribution observed cases using observation model:   mu = reporting_rate * inc_symptoms either: - `obs_model = "nbinom"`: sample Negative Binomial noise - `obs_model = "mean"`: use mu directly

what: Forecast multiple scenarios from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_scenarios_from_fit
title: Forecast multiple scenarios from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_scenarios_from_fit
text: Selects posterior iterations (shared across scenarios), simulates baseline scenario using draw indices RNG seed streams, returns absolute forecasts paired differences vs baseline.

title: Forecast multiple scenarios from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_scenarios_from_fit
code: cholera_forecast_scenarios_from_fit(   fit,   pars = NULL,   scenarios = NULL,   baseline_name = "baseline",   time = NULL,   vars = c("inc_symptoms", "cum_symptoms", "cum_deaths"),   include_cases = TRUE,   obs_model = c("nbinom", "mean"),   quantiles = c(0.025, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.975),   n_draws = 100,   burnin = 0.5,   thin = 1,   seed = 1,   dt = 0.25,   n_particles = 1,   n_threads = 1,   deterministic = FALSE,   include_baseline_in_scenarios = TRUE )

title: Forecast multiple scenarios from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_scenarios_from_fit
text: fit `cholera_fit` object. pars Baseline parameter list. NULL uses `attr(fit, "start_pars")` else `cholera_parameters()`. scenarios Scenarios run (list `cholera_scenario`, named list modify lists, grid data.frame). baseline_name Baseline scenario name (modify list may empty). time Simulation times. NULL uses `fit` data times. vars Model variables summarise. include_cases Include predicted observed cases variable "cases". obs_model One "nbinom" "mean". quantiles Quantiles compute. n_draws Number posterior draws use. burnin Burn-proportion integer. thin Thinning interval. seed Seed. dt Model time step. n_particles Particles per draw. n_threads Threads dust2. deterministic Deterministic process model toggle (supported). include_baseline_in_scenarios TRUE, ensures baseline included even passed.

title: Forecast multiple scenarios from a fitted posterior — cholera_forecast_scenarios_from_fit
text: tidy data.frame columns: scenario, type, time, variable, mean, quantiles, n_samples.

what: Health economic outputs from scenario simulations — cholera_health_econ
title: Health economic outputs from scenario simulations — cholera_health_econ
text: Computes approximate costs DALYs scenario using explicit model accumulators: - cum_vax1, cum_vax2 (doses administered) - cum_orc_treated, cum_ctc_treated (cases treated) - cum_symptoms, cum_deaths (health outcomes)

title: Health economic outputs from scenario simulations — cholera_health_econ
code: cholera_health_econ(scenario_runs, econ = NULL)

title: Health economic outputs from scenario simulations — cholera_health_econ
text: scenario_runs Output `cholera_run_scenarios()`. econ Optional named list overriding default economic parameters.

title: Health economic outputs from scenario simulations — cholera_health_econ
text: data.frame scenario-level mean costs, DALYs, components.

title: Health economic outputs from scenario simulations — cholera_health_econ
text: WASH intervention costs optionally computed parameter windows `scenario_runs` attribute `scenario_parameters` (added `cholera_run_scenarios()`).

what: Build a standard set of anticipatory action scenarios — cholera_make_aa_scenarios
title: Build a standard set of anticipatory action scenarios — cholera_make_aa_scenarios
text: Build standard set anticipatory action scenarios

title: Build a standard set of anticipatory action scenarios — cholera_make_aa_scenarios
code: cholera_make_aa_scenarios(   pars,   trigger_time = NULL,   baseline_sim = NULL,   trigger_threshold = NULL,   horizon = NULL,   include_no_intervention = TRUE,   include_aa_no_vax = TRUE,   wash_duration = 120,   care_duration = 120,   chlor_effect = 0.2,   hyg_effect = 0.2,   lat_effect = 0.1,   cati_effect = 0.1,   orc_capacity = NULL,   ctc_capacity = NULL,   vax_total_doses = 0,   vax_delay = 0,   vax_campaign_days = 6,   vax_dose_interval = 14,   ve_1 = NULL,   ve_2 = NULL,   vax_immunity_1 = NULL,   vax_immunity_2 = NULL,   baseline_name = "baseline" )

title: Build a standard set of anticipatory action scenarios — cholera_make_aa_scenarios
text: pars Baseline parameter list. trigger_time Numeric day AA package starts. `NULL`, derived `baseline_sim` `trigger_threshold`. baseline_sim Baseline simulation output used derive trigger time `trigger_time` `NULL`. trigger_threshold Threshold `inc_symptoms` used derive trigger time. horizon Optional cap intervention end times (typically max simulation time + 1). include_no_intervention Include "no_intervention" scenario zeros response levers. include_aa_no_vax Include "aa_no_vax" scenario (WASH + care, vaccination). wash_duration Duration days WASH components. care_duration Duration days ORC/CTC availability. chlor_effect, hyg_effect, lat_effect, cati_effect Fractional effects (0-1). orc_capacity, ctc_capacity Capacities (persons/day) active. vax_total_doses Total doses available. vax_delay Days trigger start vaccination. vax_campaign_days Campaign duration round. vax_dose_interval Days rounds (2-dose scenario). ve_1, ve_2 Vaccine efficacies. vax_immunity_1, vax_immunity_2 Vaccine immunity durations days. baseline_name Name baseline scenario.

title: Build a standard set of anticipatory action scenarios — cholera_make_aa_scenarios
text: list `cholera_scenario` objects.

what: Create AA scenario set using a fitted posterior baseline — cholera_make_aa_scenarios_from_fit
title: Create AA scenario set using a fitted posterior baseline — cholera_make_aa_scenarios_from_fit
text: Convenience wrapper: updates parameters posterior draws calls `cholera_make_aa_scenarios()`.

title: Create AA scenario set using a fitted posterior baseline — cholera_make_aa_scenarios_from_fit
code: cholera_make_aa_scenarios_from_fit(   fit,   pars,   draw = c("median", "mean", "sample", "index"),   burnin = 0.5,   thin = 1,   seed = 1,   trigger_time = NULL,   trigger_threshold = 15,   trigger_time_var = "inc_symptoms",   trigger_sim_time = 0:365,   trigger_sim_particles = 50,   dt = 0.25,   horizon = NULL,   ... )

title: Create AA scenario set using a fitted posterior baseline — cholera_make_aa_scenarios_from_fit
text: fit Fit object. pars Baseline parameter list. draw Posterior draw selection passed `cholera_update_from_fit()`. burnin, thin, seed Passed `cholera_update_from_fit()`. trigger_time Optional explicit trigger time. trigger_threshold trigger_time NULL, derive baseline simulation using threshold. trigger_time_var Variable used thresholding (default `inc_symptoms`). trigger_sim_time Time vector used baseline simulation deriving trigger. trigger_sim_particles Particles used baseline simulation deriving trigger. dt Model time step. horizon Optional cap intervention end times. ... arguments forwarded `cholera_make_aa_scenarios()` (e.g. vax_total_doses).

title: Create AA scenario set using a fitted posterior baseline — cholera_make_aa_scenarios_from_fit
text: list scenarios attribute `baseline_pars`.

what: Optimise intervention allocation under a budget constraint — cholera_optimise_budget
title: Optimise intervention allocation under a budget constraint — cholera_optimise_budget
text: Simple grid-search optimiser allocating budget across vaccination WASH, optional constraints. pragmatic starting point; swap sophisticated optimiser costs decision variables finalised.

title: Optimise intervention allocation under a budget constraint — cholera_optimise_budget
code: cholera_optimise_budget(   pars,   budget,   cost = list(cost_per_vaccine_dose = 2, cost_chlorination_per_person_day = 0.02,     cost_hygiene_per_person_day = 0.03, cost_latrine_per_person_day = 0.01,     cost_cati_per_person_day = 0.05, cost_per_orc_treatment = 10, cost_per_ctc_treatment     = 80),   time = 0:180,   n_particles = 100,   dt = 0.25,   seed = 1,   grid_size = 10,   min_fraction = list(vax = 0, wash = 0, care = 0),   max_fraction = list(vax = 1, wash = 1, care = 1),   max_vax_doses_per_day = Inf,   max_total_doses = Inf,   method = c("auto", "grid", "continuous") )

title: Optimise intervention allocation under a budget constraint — cholera_optimise_budget
text: pars Baseline parameter list. budget Total budget. cost Cost list (see Details). time Simulation times. n_particles Number particles evaluation. dt Time step. seed Seed. grid_size Number grid points per decision dimension. min_fraction Named list minimum allocation fractions intervention (`vax`, `wash`, `care`). max_fraction Named list maximum allocation fractions intervention (`vax`, `wash`, `care`). max_vax_doses_per_day Maximum feasible vaccination doses per day. max_total_doses Optional upper bound total vaccine doses. method Optimisation method: "auto", "grid", "continuous".

title: Optimise intervention allocation under a budget constraint — cholera_optimise_budget
text: list best allocation data.frame evaluated allocations.

title: Optimise intervention allocation under a budget constraint — cholera_optimise_budget
text: objective minimise expected deaths (mean across particles) horizon. `cost` named list can include: - cost_per_vaccine_dose - cost_chlorination_per_person_day - cost_hygiene_per_person_day - cost_latrine_per_person_day - cost_cati_per_person_day Budget spent : - vaccination doses (vax1_total_doses, vax1_doses_per_day within campaign window) - WASH (implemented setting intervention effects; placeholder mapping)

title: Plot daily incidence summary for a variable — cholera_plot_incidence
text: ggplot object.

what: Posterior predictive check plot for observed cases — cholera_plot_ppc
title: Posterior predictive check plot for observed cases — cholera_plot_ppc
text: Convenience wrapper: builds forecast observed data times including "cases" overlays observations.

title: Posterior predictive check plot for observed cases — cholera_plot_ppc
code: cholera_plot_ppc(   fit,   pars = NULL,   data = NULL,   n_draws = 200,   burnin = 0.5,   thin = 1,   seed = 1,   dt = 0.25,   n_particles = 1,   obs_model = c("nbinom", "mean") )

title: Posterior predictive check plot for observed cases — cholera_plot_ppc
text: fit `cholera_fit` object. pars Baseline parameter list. NULL uses `attr(fit, "start_pars")`. data Observed data. NULL uses `attr(fit, "data")`. n_draws Number posterior draws. burnin Burn-posterior draws. thin Thinning posterior draws. seed Seed. dt Model time step. n_particles Particles per draw. obs_model Observation model noise: "nbinom" "mean".

title: Posterior predictive check plot for observed cases — cholera_plot_ppc
text: ggplot object.

title: Plot scenario forecast summaries — cholera_plot_scenario_forecasts
text: Works output `cholera_forecast_scenarios_from_fit()`.

title: Plot scenario forecast summaries — cholera_plot_scenario_forecasts
code: cholera_plot_scenario_forecasts(   forecast,   var,   type = c("absolute", "difference"),   scenarios = NULL,   include_baseline = NULL,   facet = FALSE,   show_mean = FALSE,   data = NULL,   data_time = "time",   data_y = NULL )

title: Plot scenario forecast summaries — cholera_plot_scenario_forecasts
text: forecast Scenario forecast table. var Variable plot (e.g. "cases", "inc_symptoms", "cum_deaths"). type "absolute" scenario trajectories, "difference" scenario minus baseline. scenarios Optional character vector scenario names include. include_baseline Include baseline scenario plot. facet TRUE, facet scenario; FALSE, overlay scenarios. show_mean TRUE, add dashed mean line. data Optional observed data overlay (meaningful type = "absolute"). data_time Time column name `data`. data_y Y column name `data` (defaults `var`).

title: Plot scenario forecast summaries — cholera_plot_scenario_forecasts
text: ggplot object.

title: Prepare and validate incidence data for model fitting — cholera_prepare_data

title: Simulate the cholera model — cholera_simulate
text: Simulate cholera model

title: Simulate the cholera model — cholera_simulate
code: cholera_simulate(   pars,   time,   n_particles = 1,   dt = 0.25,   seed = 1,   which = c("simulate", "fit"),   n_threads = 1,   deterministic = FALSE )

title: Simulate the cholera model — cholera_simulate
text: pars Parameter list, typically `cholera_parameters()`. time Vector times simulate (days). n_particles Number particles. dt Discrete time step (days). seed RNG seed. bundled generator use: "simulate" (default) "fit". fit generator includes observation model needed filtering/likelihood. n_threads Threads dust2. deterministic Run deterministic mode (replacing RNG draws expectations) supported.

title: Simulate the cholera model — cholera_simulate
text: data.frame columns `time`, `particle`, model variables.

title: Posterior predictive simulation — cholera_simulate_posterior
text: Runs simulation model multiple posterior draws returns long data frame.

title: Posterior predictive simulation — cholera_simulate_posterior
code: cholera_simulate_posterior(   fit,   pars,   time,   n_draws = 50,   burnin = 0.5,   thin = 1,   seed = 1,   dt = 0.25,   n_particles = 1 )

title: Posterior predictive simulation — cholera_simulate_posterior
text: fit Fit object. pars Baseline parameter list. time Simulation times. n_draws Number posterior draws simulate. burnin, thin Passed draw selection. seed Seed. dt Model time step. n_particles Particles per posterior draw.

title: Posterior predictive simulation — cholera_simulate_posterior
text: data.frame columns: draw, time, particle, plus model variables.

title: Build standard operational scenario templates — cholera_standard_scenarios
code: cholera_standard_scenarios(   pars,   trigger_time,   horizon,   vax_total_doses = 280000,   early_offset = -14,   late_offset = 14,   campaign_days = 6,   wash_duration = 120,   care_duration = 120 )

title: Build standard operational scenario templates — cholera_standard_scenarios
text: pars Baseline parameters. trigger_time Trigger time anticipatory interventions. horizon End horizon (used cap intervention windows). vax_total_doses Total vaccine doses vaccination scenarios. early_offset Days relative trigger early vaccination start. late_offset Days relative trigger late vaccination start. campaign_days Vaccination campaign duration. wash_duration WASH intervention duration. care_duration Care intervention duration.

title: Build standard operational scenario templates — cholera_standard_scenarios
text: list `cholera_scenario` objects.

what: Derive an anticipatory action trigger time from a simulation — cholera_trigger_time_from_sim
title: Derive an anticipatory action trigger time from a simulation — cholera_trigger_time_from_sim
text: Finds first time aggregated incidence stream reaches exceeds threshold.

title: Derive an anticipatory action trigger time from a simulation — cholera_trigger_time_from_sim
code: cholera_trigger_time_from_sim(sim, threshold, var = "inc_symptoms", fun = mean)

title: Derive an anticipatory action trigger time from a simulation — cholera_trigger_time_from_sim
text: sim Output `cholera_simulate()` (single-scenario subset `cholera_run_scenarios()`). threshold Numeric threshold. var Variable name `sim` threshold . Defaults `inc_symptoms`. fun Aggregation function across particles time (defaults `mean`).

title: Derive an anticipatory action trigger time from a simulation — cholera_trigger_time_from_sim
text: single numeric trigger time (units `sim$time`), `NA_real_` never reached.

what: Update a parameter list using posterior information from a fit — cholera_update_from_fit
title: Update a parameter list using posterior information from a fit — cholera_update_from_fit
text: Update parameter list using posterior information fit

title: Update a parameter list using posterior information from a fit — cholera_update_from_fit
code: cholera_update_from_fit(   fit,   pars,   draw = c("median", "mean", "sample", "index"),   burnin = 0.5,   thin = 1,   index = NULL,   seed = 1,   validate = TRUE )

title: Update a parameter list using posterior information from a fit — cholera_update_from_fit
text: fit Fit object returned `cholera_fit_pmcmc()`. pars Baseline parameter list. draw posterior summary use: "mean", "median", "sample", "index". burnin Burn-, proportion integer count. thin Thinning interval. index `draw = "index"`, 1-based index retained iterations. seed Seed used `draw = "sample"`. validate Validate resulting parameter list.

title: Update a parameter list using posterior information from a fit — cholera_update_from_fit
text: named list parameters.
